messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] TV and the Tree of Knowledge of...
messages.msgSnippet: -=-Adam already at the apple.. his choice! TV isn t evil... you re choice to watch it or not... -=- Men are still blaming Eve for offering that apple. People
messages.messageBody:
-=-Adam already at the apple.. his choice! TV isn't evil... you're
choice to
watch it or not... -=-

Men are still blaming Eve for offering that apple.

People LIKE to feel powerless, I guess. This whole "let them choose"
philosophy is way too scary for some grown, adult humans.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] TV and the Tree of Knowledge of...
messages.msgSnippet:
Adam already at the apple.. his choice!  TV isn t evil... you re choice to
watch it or not... we all have choices!  It s your choice to sit in front of
the TV
messages.messageBody:
Adam already at the apple.. his choice! TV isn't evil... you're choice to
watch it or not... we all have choices! It's your choice to sit in front of
the TV and veg all day... and if you feel bad about that then you make the
choice to turn it off. You're vilifying it! It's NOT evil in and of itself


Unbelievable that in a world where SO many other BIG issues surround us...
that people choose to obsess about the "evil" TV! Argh!

Lesa
http://lifeacademy.homeschooljournal.net

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
